In clear, plain language I am to say to those in attendance at this conference [the General Conference of 1905] that Brother Ballenger has been allowing his mind to receive and believe specious error. . . . God has not indited the message that he is bearing. This message, if accepted, would 


                                    -245- 

undermine the pillars of our faith.--Ms 62, 1905, pp. 1, 2. ("A Warning Against False Theories," Talk, May 24, 1905.)
